document.title: Around the App - Complete Guide to Renderiq Routes, Pages, and Features
document.description: Comprehensive guide to all routes, pages, and features in Renderiq. Learn about dashboard, projects, rendering, canvas editor, gallery, and all available pages.

body.raw:
# Around the App

This comprehensive guide covers all routes, pages, and features in Renderiq, helping you navigate and understand the entire platform.

## Application Architecture

Renderiq is built with Next.js 15 using the App Router pattern:

- **Server-Side Rendering (SSR)**: Dashboard and project pages
- **Client Components**: Interactive UI elements
- **Server Actions**: Internal operations (rendering, project creation)
- **API Routes**: External integrations and webhooks
- **Static Generation**: Documentation and public pages

## Main Navigation

### Top Navigation Bar

Available on all pages (when authenticated):

- **Logo**: Click to return to home page (`/`)
- **Navigation Links**:
  - **Home** (`/`) - Landing page
  - **Gallery** (`/gallery`) - Public renders
  - **Pricing** (`/pricing`) - Pricing plans and credit packages
  - **Dashboard** (`/dashboard`) - User dashboard (when signed in)
- **User Menu** (when signed in):
  - Profile
  - Settings
  - Billing
  - Sign Out
- **Authentication Links** (when not signed in):
  - Sign In (`/login`)
  - Sign Up (`/signup`)

### Bottom Navigation (Mobile)

Mobile-optimized bottom navigation bar:

- **Home** (`/`) - Landing page
- **Render** (`/render`) - Main rendering interface
- **Gallery** (`/gallery`) - Public gallery
- **Profile** (`/dashboard/profile`) - User profile
- **Settings** (`/dashboard/settings`) - Account settings

**Note**: Bottom nav is hidden on render and project routes for better UX.

## Public Pages

### Home Page (`/`)

The main landing page featuring:

- **Hero Section**: Value proposition and call-to-action
- **Feature Highlights**: Key platform features
- **Use Case Examples**: Real-world applications
- **Testimonials**: User feedback (if available)
- **Pricing Preview**: Link to plans page
- **Sign Up CTA**: Prominent signup button

### Gallery (`/gallery`)

Public gallery of community renders:

- **Search Functionality**: Search renders by prompt or user
- **Grid View**: Visual grid of renders
- **Infinite Scroll**: Load more renders as you scroll
- **Like System**: Like renders you enjoy
- **View Counts**: See render popularity
- **Remix Functionality**: Use prompts to create new renders
- **User Attribution**: See who created each render

**Features**:
- Real-time search filtering
- Responsive grid layout
- Lazy loading for performance
- Public render discovery

### Pricing (`/pricing`)

Pricing page with subscription plans and credit packages:

- **Subscription Plans Tab**: 
  - Monthly/Annual billing options
  - Fixed credit allocations per month
  - Recurring payments via Razorpay
  - Plans: Free, Pro, Enterprise
  
- **Credit Packages Tab**:
  - One-time credit purchases
  - Pay-as-you-go model
  - Bonus credits on select packages
  - Instant credit allocation

### Use Cases (`/use-cases`)

Explore different use cases:

- **Real-time Visualization** (`/use-cases/real-time-visualization`)
- **Initial Prototyping** (`/use-cases/initial-prototyping`)
- **Material Testing** (`/use-cases/material-testing`)
- **Design Iteration** (`/use-cases/design-iteration`)

### Legal Pages

- **Privacy Policy** (`/privacy`) - Data privacy information
- **Terms of Service** (`/terms`) - Terms and conditions

## Authentication Pages

### Sign Up (`/signup`)

Account creation page:

- **Email/Password Form**: Traditional signup
- **OAuth Buttons**: Google and GitHub signup
- **Terms Acceptance**: Required checkbox
- **Email Verification**: Automatic email sent
- **Success State**: Confirmation after signup

**Features**:
- Password strength indicator
- Email validation
- OAuth redirect handling
- Error message display

### Sign In (`/login`)

Account login page:

- **Email/Password Form**: Traditional login
- **OAuth Buttons**: Google and GitHub login
- **Remember Me**: Stay signed in option
- **Forgot Password**: Password reset link
- **Sign Up Link**: Link to signup page

**Features**:
- Auto-focus on email field
- Enter key submission
- Error handling
- Redirect after login

### Verify Email (`/verify-email`)

Email verification confirmation page shown after signup.

### Auth Callback (`/auth/callback`)

OAuth callback handler (internal route) for processing OAuth redirects.

## Dashboard Pages

### Dashboard Home (`/dashboard`)

Main user dashboard with:

- **Quick Stats**:
  - Total Projects count
  - Total Renders count
  - Success Rate percentage
  - Credit Balance
- **Quick Actions**:
  - AI Chat button (links to `/render`)
  - Projects button (links to `/dashboard/projects`)
- **Recent Activity**:
  - Latest renders with status
  - Render timestamps
  - Status badges
- **Recent Projects**:
  - Latest 5 projects
  - Project status
  - Quick view links
- **Community Section**:
  - Link to gallery
  - Community highlights
- **Billing Card**:
  - Credit balance
  - Link to billing page

**Data Loading**: Server-side rendered with dynamic data fetching.

### Projects Page (`/dashboard/projects`)

Project management interface:

- **Project Grid/List View**: Toggle between views
- **Search Bar**: Search projects by name or description
- **Sort Options**: Newest, Oldest, Name (A-Z)
- **Filter by Status**: All, Completed, Processing, Failed
- **View Modes**: Default, Compact, List
- **Create Project Button**: Opens project creation modal
- **Project Cards**: Display project info and actions
- **Project Actions**: View, Edit, Duplicate, Delete

**Features**:
- Real-time search filtering
- Responsive grid layouts
- Project statistics
- Bulk operations (coming soon)

### Project Detail (`/dashboard/projects/[slug]`)

Individual project page:

- **Project Header**: Name, description, status
- **Project Metadata**: Created date, updated date, tags
- **Renders Section**: All renders in the project
- **Render Chains**: List of chains in the project
- **Project Actions**: Edit, Delete, Duplicate
- **Export Options**: Export project data
- **Settings**: Project-specific settings

**URL Structure**: Uses project slug (URL-friendly identifier) instead of ID.

### Project Chain (`/dashboard/projects/[slug]/chain/[chainId]`)

View a specific render chain:

- **Chain Header**: Name and description
- **Chain Metadata**: Creation date, render count
- **Render Sequence**: All renders in order
- **Version Navigation**: Navigate between versions
- **Chain Actions**: Edit, Delete
- **Reference Links**: Link to related renders

### Profile (`/dashboard/profile`)

User profile page:

- **Profile Information**: Name, email, avatar
- **Statistics**: Total projects, renders, credits used
- **Recent Activity**: Latest renders and projects
- **Edit Profile Button**: Opens edit modal
- **Account Settings Link**: Quick link to settings

### Settings (`/dashboard/settings`)

Account settings page:

- **Profile Settings**: Name, email, avatar
- **Security Settings**: Password change, 2FA (coming soon)
- **Notification Preferences**: Email and in-app notifications
- **Render Preferences**: Default quality, aspect ratio, style
- **Billing Information**: Link to billing page
- **Danger Zone**: Account deletion

### Billing (`/dashboard/billing`)

Billing and credit management:

- **Credit Balance**: Current available credits
- **Subscription Status**: Active plan information
- **Transaction History**: All credit transactions
- **Purchase Credits**: Buy additional credits
- **Subscription Management**: Upgrade, downgrade, cancel
- **Payment Methods**: Manage payment information

## Rendering Pages

### Render Page (`/render`)

Main rendering interface with unified chat:

- **Project Selection**: Dropdown to select project
- **Chain Selection**: Dropdown to select chain
- **Chat Interface**: Conversational rendering
- **Message History**: All previous messages and renders
- **Input Area**: Text input with controls
- **Settings Panel**: Style, quality, aspect ratio
- **Render Preview**: Real-time preview area
- **Version References**: Reference previous renders

**Features**:
- Real-time render generation
- Image upload support
- Version mention system (@v1, @v2, @latest)
- Style transfer
- Advanced settings (temperature, seed, etc.)

**Data Loading**: Server-side rendered with initial projects and chains.

### Project Render (`/project/[projectSlug]`)

Render within a specific project context (legacy route, redirects to `/render`).

### Project Chain Render (`/project/[projectSlug]/chain/[chainId]`)

Render within a specific chain context (legacy route, redirects to `/render`).

## Canvas Pages

### Canvas Home (`/canvas`)

Canvas editor landing page:

- **Project Browser**: Browse all projects
- **Chain Browser**: Browse all chains
- **Grid/List View**: Toggle view modes
- **Search**: Search projects and chains
- **Create Canvas**: Create new canvas workflow
- **Recent Canvases**: Quick access to recent work

**Data Loading**: Server-side rendered with projects and chains.

### Canvas Editor (`/canvas/[projectSlug]/[chatId]`)

Node-based visual editor:

- **React Flow Canvas**: Interactive node editor
- **Node Types**: Text, Image, Variants nodes
- **Connection System**: Connect nodes visually
- **Toolbar**: Add nodes, save, export
- **Minimap**: Navigate large canvases
- **Auto-save**: Automatic state saving
- **Graph State**: Stored in database

**Features**:
- Drag-and-drop node creation
- Visual workflow building
- Real-time data flow
- Export workflows

## API Routes

### AI Endpoints

**Text Completion** (`/api/ai/completion`):
- POST: Generate text completions
- Uses Gemini 2.5 Flash

**Chat** (`/api/ai/chat`):
- POST: Streaming chat interface
- Uses Gemini 2.5 Flash
- Supports conversation history

**Generate Image** (`/api/ai/generate-image`):
- POST: Direct image generation
- Uses Gemini 3 Pro Image Preview
- Returns image data or URL

**Generate Video** (`/api/ai/generate-video`):
- POST: Video generation
- Supports duration and quality settings
- Returns video URL

**Enhance Prompt** (`/api/ai/enhance-prompt`):
- POST: Improve prompts with AI
- Returns enhanced prompt suggestions

### Canvas Endpoints

**Graph State** (`/api/canvas/[chainId]/graph`):
- GET: Retrieve canvas graph state
- POST: Save canvas graph state
- Updates database with graph data

**Generate Variants** (`/api/canvas/generate-variants`):
- POST: Generate multiple variants
- Batch processing support

### Render Endpoints

**Renders** (`/api/renders`):
- GET: List renders (with optional project filter)
- POST: Create render (deprecated, use server actions)
- **Note**: This route is deprecated in favor of server actions

### Other Endpoints

**QR Signup** (`/api/qr-signup`):
- GET: Generate QR code for signup
- Mobile-friendly signup flow

**Video** (`/api/video`):
- POST: Video generation endpoint
- Handles video-specific parameters

## Key Features Overview

### Unified Chat Interface

The main rendering interface combining:
- Chat-based interaction
- Image upload and processing
- Style selection and customization
- Quality and aspect ratio controls
- Real-time render preview
- Version-controlled render history
- Reference system for iterations

See [Unified Chat Interface](/docs/unified-chat-interface) for detailed information.

### Render Chains

Organize renders into chains for:
- Version control and history
- Iteration tracking
- Reference management
- Workflow organization
- Automatic chain creation

See [Creating Your First Chain](/docs/creating-your-first-chain) for details.

### Canvas Editor

Node-based workflow editor for:
- Complex workflow creation
- Visual programming
- Workflow automation
- Advanced rendering pipelines
- Reusable workflow templates

### Project Management

Comprehensive project organization:
- Multiple projects per user
- Project slugs for URLs
- Project metadata and tags
- Project status tracking
- Project sharing (coming soon)

## Navigation Tips

1. **Quick Access**: Use bottom nav on mobile for main features
2. **Breadcrumbs**: Use browser back button or navigation links
3. **Search**: Use search in projects and gallery pages
4. **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Enter to submit, Esc to close modals
5. **Deep Links**: Share project URLs using slugs

## URL Structure

Renderiq uses clean, SEO-friendly URLs:

- **Projects**: `/dashboard/projects/[slug]` (not ID)
- **Chains**: `/dashboard/projects/[slug]/chain/[chainId]`
- **Canvas**: `/canvas/[projectSlug]/[chatId]`
- **Public**: `/gallery`, `/pricing`, `/use-cases`

## Next Steps

- [Creating Your First Project](/docs/creating-your-first-project) - Start creating
- [Creating Your First Chain](/docs/creating-your-first-chain) - Organize renders
- [Unified Chat Interface](/docs/unified-chat-interface) - Master rendering

## SEO Keywords

Renderiq routes, dashboard pages, project management, rendering interface, canvas editor, API endpoints, navigation guide, app structure, page overview

document.title: Changelog
document.description: Recent changes, updates, and improvements to Renderiq

body.raw:
# Changelog

All notable changes to Renderiq will be documented in this file.

## [Unreleased]

### Planned
- Enhanced mobile experience
- Additional rendering styles
- Improved error handling
- Performance optimizations
- New AI models

## [2024-12-XX] - Recent Updates

### Added
- **Documentation System**: New GitBook-style documentation site
- **Server Actions**: Migrated rendering to server actions for better performance
- **Production Logging**: Production-safe logger utility
- **Gemini 3 Support**: Full integration with Gemini 3 Pro Image Preview
- **Improved Error Handling**: Better error messages and recovery

### Changed
- **Rendering Performance**: Optimized rendering pipeline
- **API Routes**: Deprecated `/api/renders` in favor of server actions
- **Logging**: Replaced console.log with production-safe logger
- **Architecture**: Improved separation between internal (server actions) and external (APIs)

### Fixed
- **Console Logs in Production**: Fixed excessive logging in production
- **Rendering Speed**: Improved rendering performance in production
- **Error Messages**: More descriptive error messages
- **Mobile Layout**: Improved mobile interface responsiveness

## [2024-11-XX] - Previous Updates

### Added
- **Canvas Editor**: Node-based visual workflow editor
- **Render Chains**: Organize renders into chains
- **Version References**: Reference previous renders with @mentions
- **Upscaling**: 2x, 4x, and 10x upscaling options
- **Style Transfer**: Apply styles from reference images
- **Environment Controls**: Weather and lighting conditions
- **Effect Controls**: Various rendering effects

### Changed
- **Unified Chat Interface**: Enhanced with more controls
- **Project Management**: Improved project organization
- **Gallery**: Enhanced gallery with better filtering
- **Dashboard**: Redesigned dashboard layout

### Fixed
- **Image Upload**: Fixed upload issues on mobile
- **Render Quality**: Improved default quality
- **Chain Navigation**: Fixed chain rendering issues
- **Mobile UI**: Various mobile interface improvements

## [2024-10-XX] - Earlier Updates

### Added
- **OAuth Authentication**: Google and GitHub sign-in
- **Credit System**: Credit-based billing system
- **Public Gallery**: Share renders publicly
- **Project System**: Organize work into projects
- **Basic Rendering**: Initial AI rendering capabilities

### Changed
- **Authentication Flow**: Improved signup and login
- **UI/UX**: Major interface improvements
- **Performance**: Initial performance optimizations

### Fixed
- **Authentication Bugs**: Various auth-related fixes
- **Rendering Issues**: Initial rendering stability improvements

## Version History

### Current Version
- **Major**: 0
- **Minor**: 1
- **Patch**: 0

### Versioning Scheme
- **Major**: Breaking changes
- **Minor**: New features, backward compatible
- **Patch**: Bug fixes, backward compatible

## Migration Guides

### Server Actions Migration

If you're using the deprecated `/api/renders` endpoint:
- Update to use `createRenderAction` server action
- See [Rendering Infrastructure Audit Report](/RENDERING_AUDIT_REPORT.md)

### Logger Migration

If you have custom logging:
- Replace `console.log` with `logger.log` from `@/lib/utils/logger`
- Errors should use `logger.error`
- See [Logger Documentation](/lib/utils/logger.ts)

## Deprecations

### Deprecated Features

- **`/api/renders` Route**: Use server actions instead
- **Console.log in Production**: Use logger utility
- **Direct API Calls**: Prefer server actions for internal use

### Removal Timeline

- Deprecated features will be removed in next major version
- Migration guides available for all deprecations
- Support available during migration period

## Breaking Changes

### None Currently

No breaking changes in recent releases. All changes are backward compatible.

## Security Updates

### Recent Security Improvements

- Enhanced authentication security
- Improved API security
- Better error handling to prevent information leakage
- Production-safe logging

## Performance Improvements

### Recent Optimizations

- Server actions for reduced HTTP overhead
- Database query optimizations
- Image processing improvements
- Caching enhancements

## Known Issues

See [Known Issues](/docs/known-issues) for current issues and workarounds.

## Feedback

We welcome feedback on:
- New features
- Bug reports
- Performance issues
- Documentation improvements

Contact us at: support@renderiq.io

document.title: Creating Your First Chain - Render Chain Management Guide
document.description: Learn how to create and manage render chains in Renderiq. Complete guide covering automatic chain creation, manual chain management, version references, and chain organization.

body.raw:
# Creating Your First Chain

Render chains are the backbone of iteration management in Renderiq. They organize related renders into sequences, allowing you to track design evolution and reference previous versions. This guide covers everything about creating and managing render chains.

## What is a Render Chain?

A render chain is a collection of renders organized in sequential order. Each chain:

- **Groups Related Renders**: Keeps related iterations together
- **Maintains Version History**: Tracks render sequence and order
- **Enables References**: Allows referencing previous renders in new generations
- **Tracks Iteration Progress**: Shows how designs evolve over time
- **Preserves Context**: Maintains context between related renders

### Chain Structure

Each chain includes:
- **Chain ID**: Unique identifier (UUID)
- **Project ID**: Parent project reference
- **Name**: Descriptive chain name
- **Description**: Optional chain description
- **Renders**: Array of renders in sequence
- **Chain Position**: Position of each render in sequence
- **Timestamps**: Created and updated dates

## Why Use Chains?

Chains are useful for:
- **Iteration Tracking**: See how your design evolves
- **Version Control**: Reference specific versions
- **Context Preservation**: Maintain context between renders
- **Organization**: Keep related work together

## Creating a Chain

### Method 1: Automatic Creation (Recommended)

When you create your first render in a project, a default chain is automatically created:

**Automatic Chain Creation Process**:
1. User generates first render in a project
2. System checks for existing chains in the project
3. If no chains exist, creates a new default chain
4. Chain name: `[Project Name] - Iterations`
5. Description: "Automatic chain for render iterations"
6. Render is added to the chain at position 0

**Benefits**:
- No manual setup required
- Consistent naming convention
- Automatic organization
- Seamless workflow

### Method 2: Manual Creation via API

Chains can be created manually using the `createRenderChain` server action:

```typescript
const result = await createRenderChain(
  projectId,
  'My Custom Chain',
  'Description of the chain'
);
```

**Use Cases**:
- Creating multiple chains for different design directions
- Organizing renders by client or phase
- Separating experimental from production renders

### Method 3: From Render Page

1. Navigate to `/render`
2. Select your project from the dropdown
3. **Automatic**: If no chain exists, one is created automatically
4. **Manual Selection**: Select an existing chain from the chain dropdown
5. Generate render (it will be added to selected chain)

## Managing Chains

### Viewing Chains

View all chains in a project:
1. Go to project detail page
2. Navigate to the "Chains" section
3. See all chains with render counts

### Chain Details

Each chain shows:
- Chain name and description
- Number of renders
- Creation date
- Last updated date
- Render previews

### Editing Chains

1. Go to chain detail page
2. Click "Edit Chain"
3. Update name or description
4. Save changes

### Deleting Chains

1. Go to chain detail page
2. Click "Delete Chain"
3. Confirm deletion

**Warning**: Deleting a chain will not delete the renders, but they will be removed from the chain.

## Adding Renders to Chains

### Automatic Addition

When generating a render:
- If a chain is selected, the render is automatically added
- Renders are added in sequence
- Each render gets a position number

### Manual Addition

1. Go to render detail page
2. Click "Add to Chain"
3. Select the chain
4. Choose position (optional)

## Chain Navigation

### Viewing Chain Renders

1. Navigate to chain detail page
2. See all renders in sequence
3. Click any render to view details
4. Use navigation arrows to move between renders

### Chain Position

Each render in a chain has a position:
- Position 0: First render
- Position 1: Second render
- And so on...

Positions help maintain order and allow referencing by position.

## Referencing Previous Renders

### Using Mentions

In the unified chat interface, you can reference previous renders:
- Use `@v1` to reference the first render
- Use `@v2` to reference the second render
- Use `@latest` to reference the most recent render

### Visual References

When creating a new render:
- Previous renders in the chain are shown
- Click to use as reference
- Reference render appears in the prompt

## Chain Best Practices

### Naming Conventions

- Use descriptive names: "Exterior Design Iterations"
- Include version info: "Kitchen Design v2"
- Use consistent naming across projects

### Organization

- One chain per design direction
- Create new chains for major changes
- Archive completed chains

### Documentation

- Add descriptions to chains
- Use render notes to document changes
- Keep track of what worked and what didn't

## Advanced Features

### Chain Branching

Create variations by:
1. Selecting a render as starting point
2. Creating a new chain
3. Adding the selected render as first render
4. Building from there

### Chain Merging

Currently not available, but you can:
- Manually add renders from one chain to another
- Reference renders across chains

## Troubleshooting

### Can't Create Chain

- Ensure you have a project selected
- Check if you have permission
- Verify project isn't archived

### Renders Not Appearing in Chain

- Check if render was added to chain
- Verify you're viewing the correct chain
- Refresh the page

### Chain Not Updating

- Refresh the page
- Check if render generation completed
- Verify chain selection

## Next Steps

- [Unified Chat Interface](/docs/unified-chat-interface) - Learn how to generate renders
- [Prompt Engineering](/docs/prompt-engineering) - Master the art of prompts

document.title: Creating Your First Project - Complete Guide to Project Management in Renderiq
document.description: Learn how to create, manage, and organize projects in Renderiq. Step-by-step guide covering project creation, upload options, organization, and best practices.

body.raw:
# Creating Your First Project

Projects are the foundation of your work in Renderiq. Each project contains your sketches, renders, and render chains. This comprehensive guide covers everything you need to know about creating and managing projects.

## What is a Project?

A project in Renderiq is a container that organizes:

- **Original Sketches/Images**: Your uploaded source materials
- **All Renders**: Every render generated from those sketches
- **Render Chains**: Organized sequences of related renders
- **Project Metadata**: Name, description, tags, status
- **Project Settings**: Default preferences and configurations

### Project Structure

Each project includes:
- **Unique ID**: UUID for database reference
- **Slug**: URL-friendly identifier (e.g., `modern-house-design`)
- **User ID**: Owner of the project
- **Name**: Display name
- **Description**: Optional project description
- **Original Image ID**: Reference to uploaded sketch
- **Status**: Processing, Completed, or Failed
- **Tags**: Array of tags for organization
- **Metadata**: JSON object for additional data
- **Timestamps**: Created and updated dates

## Creating a Project

### Method 1: From the Dashboard Projects Page

1. **Navigate to Projects**: Go to `/dashboard/projects`
2. **Click "New Project"**: Button in the top right
3. **Fill Project Details**:
   - **Project Name**: Enter a descriptive name (required)
   - **Description**: Add optional description
4. **Upload Initial Image** (optional):
   - **Drag & Drop**: Drag image file into upload area
   - **Click to Browse**: Click upload area to select file
   - **Supported Formats**: JPG, PNG, WebP
   - **Maximum Size**: 10MB recommended
5. **Use Shape Generator** (alternative):
   - Click "Generate Shape" button
   - Select shape type
   - Shape becomes project's initial image
6. **Create Project**: Click "Create Project" button

**What Happens**:
- Image is uploaded to Supabase Storage
- Project record is created in database
- Unique slug is generated from project name
- Project status is set to "processing"
- You're redirected to project detail page

### Method 2: From the Render Page

1. **Navigate to Render**: Go to `/render`
2. **No Project Selected**: If no project is selected, you'll see a prompt
3. **Click "Create New Project"**: Button in the prompt
4. **Follow Steps**: Same as Method 1

### Method 3: Using Server Actions

Projects can be created programmatically using the `createProject` server action:

```typescript
const formData = new FormData();
formData.append('file', imageFile);
formData.append('projectName', 'My Project');
formData.append('description', 'Project description');

const result = await createProject(formData);
```

## Project Upload Options

### Image Upload

**Supported Formats**:
- JPEG/JPG
- PNG
- WebP

**Size Recommendations**:
- **Maximum**: 10MB
- **Recommended**: 2-5MB
- **Resolution**: 1024x1024 or higher for best results

**Upload Methods**:
1. **Drag & Drop**: Drag file directly onto upload area
2. **Click to Browse**: Click upload area to open file browser
3. **Paste from Clipboard**: Copy image and paste (if supported by browser)

### Shape Generator

Generate basic shapes as starting points:

- **Square**: Perfect square shape
- **Rectangle**: Rectangular shape
- **Circle**: Circular shape
- **Custom**: Define custom dimensions

**Use Cases**:
- Quick prototyping
- Testing workflows
- Learning the platform
- Creating placeholder projects

### Dicebear Avatars

Use Dicebear-generated avatars as project images:

- **Automatic Generation**: Unique avatar per project
- **Consistent Style**: Cohesive visual identity
- **No Upload Required**: Instant project creation

## Project Organization

### Using Tags

Tags help organize projects:

- **Add Tags**: When creating or editing project
- **Multiple Tags**: Add multiple tags per project
- **Filter by Tags**: Filter projects by tags (coming soon)
- **Tag Suggestions**: Common tags suggested

**Best Practices**:
- Use consistent naming (e.g., "residential", "commercial")
- Create tag hierarchy (e.g., "architecture", "interior-design")
- Use descriptive tags (e.g., "modern", "traditional")

### Project Status

Projects have three statuses:

- **Processing**: Project is being set up or processed
- **Completed**: Project is ready for use
- **Failed**: Project creation or processing failed

**Status Updates**:
- Automatically updated during project lifecycle
- Can be manually updated in project settings
- Affects project visibility and actions

### Project Metadata

Store additional information in metadata:

- **Custom Fields**: Add custom key-value pairs
- **Project Notes**: Internal notes and reminders
- **Client Information**: Client details (if applicable)
- **Timeline**: Project timeline and milestones

## Project Management

### Viewing Projects

**Projects Page** (`/dashboard/projects`):
- Grid view with project cards
- List view for detailed information
- Compact view for quick browsing
- Search and filter functionality

**Project Detail** (`/dashboard/projects/[slug]`):
- Full project information
- All renders in project
- Render chains
- Project settings

### Editing Projects

1. **Navigate to Project**: Go to project detail page
2. **Click "Edit"**: Button in project header
3. **Update Information**:
   - Change project name
   - Update description
   - Modify tags
   - Update metadata
4. **Save Changes**: Click "Save" button

**Note**: Project slug cannot be changed after creation.

### Duplicating Projects

Create a copy of an existing project:

1. **Navigate to Projects**: Go to `/dashboard/projects`
2. **Find Project**: Locate project to duplicate
3. **Click Duplicate**: Duplicate button on project card
4. **Confirm**: Confirm duplication
5. **New Project Created**: Copy created with "- Copy" suffix

**What Gets Duplicated**:
- Project name and description
- Tags and metadata
- Original image (reference copied)
- Project settings

**What Doesn't Get Duplicated**:
- Renders (empty project)
- Render chains (empty project)
- Project slug (new slug generated)

### Deleting Projects

1. **Navigate to Project**: Go to project detail page
2. **Click "Delete"**: Delete button in project header
3. **Confirm Deletion**: Type project name to confirm
4. **Project Deleted**: Project and all associated data removed

**Warning**: Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone.

**What Gets Deleted**:
- Project record
- All renders in project
- All render chains
- Project metadata

**What's Preserved**:
- Public gallery renders (if made public)
- Storage files (may be cleaned up later)

## Project Settings

### Basic Settings

Access from project detail page:

- **Name**: Project display name
- **Description**: Project description
- **Tags**: Project tags
- **Visibility**: Public or private (coming soon)

### Advanced Settings

- **Default Style**: Set default rendering style
- **Default Quality**: Set default quality level
- **Default Aspect Ratio**: Set default aspect ratio
- **Auto-save**: Enable/disable auto-save
- **Notifications**: Project-specific notifications

## Project URLs and Sharing

### Project Slugs

Projects use URL-friendly slugs:

- **Format**: Generated from project name
- **Example**: "Modern House Design"  `modern-house-design`
- **Uniqueness**: Automatically ensures uniqueness
- **Persistence**: Cannot be changed after creation

### Project URLs

- **Detail Page**: `/dashboard/projects/[slug]`
- **Shareable**: Can be shared with team members (coming soon)
- **SEO-Friendly**: Clean URLs for better SEO

## Best Practices

### Naming Projects

- **Be Descriptive**: Use clear, descriptive names
- **Include Context**: Add project type or client name
- **Use Dates**: Include dates for time-based projects
- **Avoid Special Characters**: Keep names simple

**Good Examples**:
- "Modern Residential House - 2024"
- "Commercial Office Building - Client ABC"
- "Interior Design - Living Room"

**Poor Examples**:
- "Project 1"
- "Test"
- "New Project"

### Organizing Projects

- **Use Tags**: Tag projects consistently
- **Group Related**: Keep related projects together
- **Archive Old**: Archive completed projects
- **Regular Cleanup**: Delete unused projects

### Project Workflow

1. **Create Project**: Start with clear name and description
2. **Upload Sketch**: Add initial sketch or use shape generator
3. **Generate Renders**: Create renders using unified chat
4. **Organize Chains**: Group related renders into chains
5. **Iterate**: Refine and improve renders
6. **Export**: Export final renders when complete

## Troubleshooting

### Can't Upload Image

**Common Issues**:
- File format not supported
- File size too large
- Browser compatibility
- Network issues

**Solutions**:
- Check file format (JPG, PNG, WebP)
- Compress image if too large
- Try different browser
- Check internet connection
- Clear browser cache

### Project Not Appearing

**Common Issues**:
- Project creation failed
- Wrong account
- Filter applied
- Search query active

**Solutions**:
- Refresh the page
- Check if you're on correct account
- Clear filters
- Clear search query
- Check project status

### Upload Fails

**Common Issues**:
- File corrupted
- Network timeout
- Storage quota exceeded
- Server error

**Solutions**:
- Try different image
- Check file isn't corrupted
- Reduce file size
- Try again later
- Contact support

### Slug Conflicts

**Note**: Slugs are automatically made unique. If a slug exists, a number is appended (e.g., `project-name-2`).

## Next Steps

After creating your project:

- [Creating Your First Chain](/docs/creating-your-first-chain) - Organize renders
- [Unified Chat Interface](/docs/unified-chat-interface) - Generate renders
- [Prompt Engineering](/docs/prompt-engineering) - Write better prompts

## SEO Keywords

Renderiq projects, project management, create project, upload sketches, project organization, project tags, project settings, architectural projects, design projects

document.title: Getting Started with Renderiq - AI Architectural Visualization Platform
document.description: Learn how to get started with Renderiq, the AI-powered platform for transforming architectural sketches into photorealistic renders using SOTA multimodal agents like Google Gemini with nano banana Itegration, xAI Grok, Miidjourney, OpenAI 5 & Sora. Complete guide for architects and designers.

body.raw:
# Getting Started with Renderiq

Welcome to **Renderiq** - the AI-powered architectural visualization platform that transforms your sketches and prompts into photorealistic renders and videos using Google's Gemini 3 Pro Image Preview model.

## What is Renderiq?

Renderiq is a comprehensive AI architectural visualization platform designed for architects, designers, and creative professionals. Using Google's Gemini 3 Pro Image Preview and Gemini 2.5 Flash models, Renderiq enables you to:

- Transform architectural sketches into photorealistic visualizations
- Generate high-quality images and videos from text prompts
- Iterate on designs with version-controlled render chains
- Organize work into projects with advanced project management
- Share and discover renders in the public gallery

## Key Features

### AI-Powered Rendering
- **Google Gemini 3 Pro Image Preview**: State-of-the-art image generation
- **Google Gemini 2.5 Flash**: Fast text generation and chat capabilities
- **Multiple Quality Levels**: Standard, High, and Ultra quality options
- **Aspect Ratio Control**: 16:9, 9:16, 1:1, 4:3, and 21:9 support

### Project Management
- **Project Organization**: Create and manage multiple architectural projects
- **Render Chains**: Version-controlled sequences of related renders
- **Automatic Chain Creation**: Default chains created automatically for new projects
- **Project Slugs**: URL-friendly project identifiers for easy sharing

### Unified Chat Interface
- **Conversational Rendering**: Chat-based interface for natural interaction
- **Image Upload Support**: Upload sketches and reference images
- **Version References**: Reference previous renders using @mentions (@v1, @v2, @latest)
- **Real-time Preview**: See renders as they're generated

### Canvas Editor
- **Node-Based Workflows**: Visual programming with React Flow
- **Workflow Automation**: Create complex rendering pipelines
- **Auto-save**: Automatic saving of canvas state

### Credit System
- **Flexible Billing**: Credit-based system for pay-as-you-go usage
- **Subscription Plans**: Monthly plans with included credits
- **Transaction History**: Track all credit usage and purchases

## Quick Start Guide

### Step 1: Create Your Account

1. Navigate to the [Sign Up page](/signup)
2. Choose your signup method:
   - **Email/Password**: Traditional signup with email verification
   - **OAuth**: Quick signup with Google or GitHub
3. Verify your email (if using email/password)
4. Complete your profile setup

### Step 2: Create Your First Project

1. Navigate to `/dashboard/projects` or `/render`
2. Click "New Project" or "Create Project"
3. Enter a project name and optional description
4. Upload an initial sketch (optional) or use the shape generator
5. Click "Create Project"

### Step 3: Generate Your First Render

1. Go to `/render` or select your project
2. Enter a descriptive prompt in the chat interface
3. Configure settings:
   - **Style**: Choose from predefined styles
   - **Quality**: Standard (1 credit), High (2 credits), or Ultra (3 credits)
   - **Aspect Ratio**: Select your preferred ratio
4. Click "Generate" or press Enter
5. Wait for your render to complete

### Step 4: Iterate and Refine

1. Review your generated render
2. Use version references to build on previous renders
3. Upload reference images for style transfer
4. Adjust prompts and settings for better results
5. Create render chains to track iterations

## System Architecture

Renderiq uses a modern, scalable architecture:

- **Frontend**: Next.js 15 with React 19 and TypeScript
- **Backend**: Next.js Server Actions for internal operations
- **API Routes**: External API endpoints for integrations
- **Database**: PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM
- **Storage**: Supabase Storage for file management
- **Authentication**: Supabase Auth with OAuth support
- **AI Models**: Google Generative AI (Gemini 3 Pro, Gemini 2.5 Flash)

## Credit Costs

Understanding credit costs helps you plan your usage:

- **Image Generation**:
  - Standard Quality: 1 credit
  - High Quality: 2 credits
  - Ultra Quality: 3 credits

- **Video Generation**:
  - Base Cost: 5 credits
  - Duration Multiplier: Scales with video length
  - Model Multiplier: Higher quality models cost more

- **Upscaling**: Varies based on scale factor and quality

## What's Next?

Now that you understand the basics:

- [Making Your Account](/docs/making-your-account) - Detailed account setup and management
- [Around the App](/docs/around-the-app) - Complete guide to all features and pages
- [Creating Your First Project](/docs/creating-your-first-project) - Step-by-step project creation
- [Creating Your First Chain](/docs/creating-your-first-chain) - Organize renders with chains
- [Unified Chat Interface](/docs/unified-chat-interface) - Master the rendering interface
- [Prompt Engineering](/docs/prompt-engineering) - Write effective prompts for better results

## Need Help?

- Check [Known Issues](/docs/known-issues) for common problems and solutions
- Review the [Changelog](/docs/changelog) for recent updates
- Contact support for additional assistance

## SEO Keywords

Renderiq, AI architectural visualization, Google Gemini 3 Pro, architectural rendering, AI design tools, photorealistic renders, architectural visualization software, AI image generation, design iteration, render chains, project management for architects

document.title: Known Issues

body.raw:
# Known Issues

This page documents known issues and their workarounds. We're constantly working to fix these issues.

## Authentication Issues

### Email Verification Not Received

**Issue**: Email verification email not arriving after signup.

**Solutions**:
- Check spam/junk folder
- Wait a few minutes (emails can be delayed)
- Request a new verification email
- Try a different email provider
- Contact support if issue persists

**Status**: Under investigation

### OAuth Login Fails

**Issue**: Google or GitHub login doesn't work.

**Solutions**:
- Clear browser cache and cookies
- Try a different browser
- Ensure you're using the same OAuth account you signed up with
- Check if OAuth account has proper permissions
- Try incognito/private mode

**Status**: Rare occurrence, usually browser-related

## Rendering Issues

### Slow Generation Times

**Issue**: Renders take longer than expected.

**Causes**:
- High quality settings (ultra quality is slower)
- Server load
- Complex prompts
- Large image uploads

**Solutions**:
- Use standard or high quality for faster results
- Simplify prompts
- Reduce image size
- Try again during off-peak hours

**Status**: Performance optimizations ongoing

### Poor Quality Results

**Issue**: Generated renders don't match expectations.

**Solutions**:
- Increase quality setting
- Add more detail to prompts
- Use reference images
- Try different styles
- Experiment with temperature settings
- See [Prompt Engineering](/docs/prompt-engineering) guide

**Status**: AI model improvements ongoing

### Generation Fails

**Issue**: Render generation fails with error.

**Common Causes**:
- Insufficient credits
- Invalid prompt
- Server error
- Network issues

**Solutions**:
- Check credit balance
- Verify prompt is valid
- Check internet connection
- Try again
- Contact support if issue persists

**Status**: Monitoring and improving error handling

## Image Upload Issues

### Upload Fails

**Issue**: Can't upload images.

**Solutions**:
- Check file format (JPG, PNG, WebP)
- Ensure file size under 10MB
- Try a different browser
- Clear browser cache
- Check internet connection

**Status**: File size limits may be adjusted

### Image Not Displaying

**Issue**: Uploaded image doesn't appear.

**Solutions**:
- Refresh the page
- Re-upload the image
- Check file isn't corrupted
- Try a different image
- Clear browser cache

**Status**: Under investigation

## UI/UX Issues

### Layout Issues on Mobile

**Issue**: Interface doesn't display correctly on mobile.

**Solutions**:
- Rotate device to landscape
- Use desktop view if available
- Update browser to latest version
- Clear browser cache

**Status**: Mobile optimizations ongoing

### Slow Page Loading

**Issue**: Pages load slowly.

**Solutions**:
- Check internet connection
- Clear browser cache
- Disable browser extensions
- Try a different browser
- Check if issue is site-wide

**Status**: Performance optimizations ongoing

## Account Issues

### Credits Not Updating

**Issue**: Credits don't reflect after purchase or generation.

**Solutions**:
- Refresh the page
- Wait a few minutes
- Check transaction history
- Contact support with transaction ID

**Status**: Rare occurrence, usually resolves automatically

### Projects Not Loading

**Issue**: Projects don't appear or load slowly.

**Solutions**:
- Refresh the page
- Check internet connection
- Clear browser cache
- Try a different browser
- Check if you're on the correct account

**Status**: Database query optimizations ongoing

## Browser Compatibility

### Known Browser Issues

**Chrome/Edge**: Full support
**Firefox**: Full support
**Safari**: Minor rendering differences
**Mobile Browsers**: Some features may be limited

### Recommended Browsers

- Chrome (latest)
- Firefox (latest)
- Edge (latest)
- Safari (latest, macOS/iOS)

## API Issues

### Rate Limiting

**Issue**: Too many requests error.

**Solutions**:
- Wait a few minutes
- Reduce request frequency
- Use server actions instead of API routes
- Contact support for higher limits

**Status**: Rate limits may be adjusted

### API Errors

**Issue**: API returns errors.

**Solutions**:
- Check API documentation
- Verify request format
- Check authentication
- Contact support

**Status**: API improvements ongoing

## Data Issues

### Missing Renders

**Issue**: Previously generated renders disappear.

**Solutions**:
- Check if project was deleted
- Verify you're on the correct account
- Check filters/search terms
- Contact support

**Status**: Rare occurrence, investigating

### Data Not Syncing

**Issue**: Changes don't save or sync.

**Solutions**:
- Refresh the page
- Check internet connection
- Try again
- Clear browser cache
- Contact support if issue persists

**Status**: Sync improvements ongoing

## Performance Issues

### Slow Interface

**Issue**: Interface is slow or laggy.

**Solutions**:
- Close other browser tabs
- Disable browser extensions
- Update browser
- Clear browser cache
- Check device performance

**Status**: Performance optimizations ongoing

### High Memory Usage

**Issue**: Browser uses too much memory.

**Solutions**:
- Close unused tabs
- Refresh the page periodically
- Use fewer simultaneous renders
- Close and reopen browser

**Status**: Memory optimizations ongoing

## Reporting Issues

### How to Report

If you encounter an issue not listed here:

1. **Check Status**: Verify it's not a known issue
2. **Gather Information**:
   - Browser and version
   - Device and OS
   - Steps to reproduce
   - Screenshots if applicable
   - Error messages
3. **Contact Support**: 
   - Email: support@renderiq.io
   - Include all gathered information

### What We Need

When reporting issues, please include:
- **Description**: What happened
- **Expected**: What should have happened
- **Steps**: How to reproduce
- **Environment**: Browser, OS, device
- **Screenshots**: If applicable
- **Error Messages**: Full error text

## Status Updates

We regularly update this page with:
- New known issues
- Resolved issues
- Workaround improvements
- Status changes

Check back regularly for updates.

## Getting Help

If you need additional help:
- Check [Changelog](/docs/changelog) for recent fixes
- Review [Prompt Engineering](/docs/prompt-engineering) for rendering tips
- Contact support for urgent issues

document.title: Making Your Renderiq Account - Complete Signup and Account Management Guide
document.description: Learn how to create, verify, and manage your Renderiq account. Complete guide covering email signup, OAuth authentication, profile management, and credit system.

body.raw:
# Making Your Account

This comprehensive guide covers everything you need to know about creating and managing your Renderiq account, from initial signup to advanced account settings.

## Signing Up for Renderiq

### Option 1: Email and Password Signup

The traditional email/password signup process:

1. **Navigate to Sign Up**: Go to `/signup` or click "Sign Up" in the navigation
2. **Enter Your Information**:
   - **Full Name**: Your display name (required)
   - **Email Address**: A valid email address (required)
   - **Password**: Minimum 6 characters (required)
   - **Confirm Password**: Must match your password (required)
3. **Accept Terms**: Check the box to accept Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
4. **Create Account**: Click "Create account" button
5. **Email Verification**: Check your email for a verification link
6. **Verify Email**: Click the verification link in the email

**Important**: Email verification is required before you can sign in. The verification email is sent automatically after signup.

### Option 2: OAuth Signup (Google or GitHub)

Quick signup using OAuth providers:

1. **Navigate to Sign Up**: Go to `/signup`
2. **Choose Provider**: Click either the "Google" or "GitHub" button
3. **Authorize Renderiq**: Grant permissions in the OAuth popup
4. **Account Created**: Your account is created automatically
5. **No Email Verification**: OAuth signups don't require email verification

**Note**: Use the same OAuth provider for future logins. Your account is linked to that provider.

## Signing In

### Email and Password Login

1. **Navigate to Login**: Go to `/login` or click "Sign In"
2. **Enter Credentials**:
   - Email address used during signup
   - Your password
3. **Remember Me** (Optional): Check to stay signed in
4. **Sign In**: Click "Sign in" button

**Troubleshooting**: If you can't sign in:
- Verify your email address is correct
- Ensure you've verified your email (check spam folder)
- Try resetting your password
- Contact support if issues persist

### OAuth Login

1. **Navigate to Login**: Go to `/login`
2. **Choose Provider**: Click the same OAuth provider you used for signup
3. **Authorize**: Grant permissions if prompted
4. **Signed In**: You're automatically signed in

**Important**: You must use the same OAuth provider (Google or GitHub) that you used during signup.

## Account Architecture

Renderiq uses a layered authentication system:

### Authentication Flow

1. **Supabase Auth**: Handles authentication and session management
2. **User Profile Creation**: Automatic profile creation after email verification
3. **Credit System**: Initial credits assigned upon account creation
4. **Database Integration**: User data stored in PostgreSQL

### User Profile Structure

Your account includes:
- **User ID**: Unique identifier (UUID)
- **Email**: Your email address
- **Name**: Display name
- **Avatar**: Profile picture (optional)
- **Credits**: Current credit balance
- **Subscription**: Active subscription (if any)
- **Projects**: All your architectural projects
- **Renders**: All generated renders

## Account Settings

Access your account settings from the dashboard:

### Navigation to Settings

1. Click on your profile icon in the top right corner
2. Select "Settings" from the dropdown
3. Or navigate directly to `/dashboard/settings`

### Available Settings Sections

#### Profile Information
- Update your display name
- Change your email address
- Upload or change your avatar
- Update profile description

#### Security Settings
- Change password (email/password accounts)
- Manage two-factor authentication (coming soon)
- View active sessions
- Security activity log

#### Notification Preferences
- Email notifications for renders
- In-app notifications
- Marketing emails (opt-in/opt-out)
- System updates

#### Billing and Credits
- View current credit balance
- Purchase additional credits
- Manage subscription
- View transaction history
- Update payment methods

#### Render Preferences
- Default quality settings
- Default aspect ratio
- Default style preferences
- Auto-save settings

## Credits System

### Understanding Credits

Renderiq uses a credit-based billing system:

- **Credits**: Virtual currency for generating renders
- **Balance**: Current available credits
- **Transactions**: History of all credit usage
- **Reset**: Credits may reset based on subscription plan

### Credit Costs

**Image Generation**:
- Standard Quality: 1 credit
- High Quality: 2 credits
- Ultra Quality: 3 credits

**Video Generation**:
- Base Cost: 5 credits
- Additional costs based on duration and model

**Upscaling**:
- Varies based on scale factor (2x, 4x, 10x)

### Getting Credits

1. **Free Tier**: Initial credits upon signup
2. **Subscription Plans**: Monthly credits included with plans
3. **One-time Purchase**: Buy credits as needed from billing page
4. **Referrals**: Earn credits by referring friends (coming soon)

### Managing Credits

- **View Balance**: Check `/dashboard/billing` for current balance
- **Purchase Credits**: Buy additional credits from billing page
- **Transaction History**: View all credit transactions
- **Usage Tracking**: Monitor credit usage per project

## Account Management

### Updating Your Profile

1. Navigate to `/dashboard/profile`
2. Click "Edit Profile" button
3. Update your information:
   - Name
   - Email (requires verification)
   - Avatar (upload new image)
   - Bio/Description
4. Click "Save Changes"

### Changing Your Password

1. Go to `/dashboard/settings`
2. Navigate to "Security" section
3. Click "Change Password"
4. Enter current password
5. Enter new password (minimum 6 characters)
6. Confirm new password
7. Click "Update Password"

**Note**: Password changes require re-authentication for security.

### Email Verification

If you need to verify or change your email:

1. Go to `/dashboard/settings`
2. Navigate to "Profile" section
3. Click "Verify Email" or "Change Email"
4. Check your email for verification link
5. Click the link to verify

### Deleting Your Account

**Warning**: Account deletion is permanent and cannot be undone.

1. Go to `/dashboard/settings`
2. Scroll to "Danger Zone" section
3. Click "Delete Account"
4. Enter your password to confirm
5. Type "DELETE" to confirm deletion
6. Click "Delete Account"

**What Gets Deleted**:
- All projects and renders
- All credit balance (non-refundable)
- All account data
- All uploaded files

**What's Preserved**:
- Public gallery renders (if made public)
- Transaction records (for legal compliance)

## Troubleshooting

### Can't Sign In

**Common Issues**:
- Email not verified (check spam folder)
- Incorrect password (use password reset)
- Wrong OAuth provider (use same provider as signup)
- Account locked (contact support)

**Solutions**:
1. Verify email address is correct
2. Check spam folder for verification email
3. Use password reset if forgotten
4. Clear browser cache and cookies
5. Try incognito/private mode
6. Contact support if issues persist

### Email Verification Issues

**If verification email not received**:
1. Check spam/junk folder
2. Wait a few minutes (emails can be delayed)
3. Request new verification email from settings
4. Try a different email provider
5. Contact support with your email address

### OAuth Issues

**If OAuth login fails**:
1. Ensure you're using the same provider (Google/GitHub)
2. Check OAuth account permissions
3. Clear browser cache
4. Try different browser
5. Check if OAuth account is active

### Credit Issues

**If credits not updating**:
1. Refresh the page
2. Wait a few minutes for sync
3. Check transaction history
4. Contact support with transaction ID

## Best Practices

### Account Security
- Use a strong, unique password
- Enable two-factor authentication when available
- Don't share your account credentials
- Log out from shared devices
- Review security activity regularly

### Credit Management
- Monitor credit usage regularly
- Set up subscription for consistent credits
- Purchase credits in advance for large projects
- Track credit costs per render type

### Profile Optimization
- Use a clear profile picture
- Add a descriptive bio
- Keep email address updated
- Verify email for account recovery

## Next Steps

After setting up your account:

- [Around the App](/docs/around-the-app) - Explore all features
- [Creating Your First Project](/docs/creating-your-first-project) - Start creating
- [Unified Chat Interface](/docs/unified-chat-interface) - Learn the interface

## SEO Keywords

Renderiq account, signup guide, OAuth authentication, email verification, account management, credit system, user profile, account settings, password reset, billing management

document.title: Prompt Engineering
document.description: Master the art of writing effective prompts for AI rendering

body.raw:
# Prompt Engineering

Writing effective prompts is key to getting great results from Renderiq. This guide will teach you how to craft prompts that produce the renders you envision.

## Understanding Prompts

A prompt is a text description that tells the AI what to generate. The better your prompt, the better your results.

### What Makes a Good Prompt?

1. **Specificity**: Clear and detailed descriptions
2. **Structure**: Organized information
3. **Context**: Relevant background information
4. **Style**: Consistent style references
5. **Constraints**: What to include/exclude

## Prompt Structure

### Basic Structure

```
[Subject] + [Style] + [Details] + [Environment] + [Quality Indicators]
```

### Example

```
Modern minimalist house with floor-to-ceiling windows, Scandinavian style, 
white walls and natural wood accents, surrounded by pine trees, 
sunny day with soft shadows, photorealistic, high detail, 
architectural photography style
```

## Key Components

### 1. Subject

Clearly describe what you're creating:
- **Building Type**: House, office, restaurant, etc.
- **Architectural Style**: Modern, traditional, contemporary, etc.
- **Key Features**: Windows, materials, layout, etc.

**Good Examples:**
- "Contemporary glass office building"
- "Traditional Japanese tea house"
- "Modernist concrete apartment complex"

**Poor Examples:**
- "Building"
- "Nice house"
- "Architecture"

### 2. Style

Specify the visual style:
- **Architectural Style**: Modern, Art Deco, Brutalist, etc.
- **Rendering Style**: Photorealistic, sketch, wireframe, etc.
- **Artistic Style**: Minimalist, ornate, industrial, etc.

**Examples:**
- "Brutalist concrete architecture"
- "Art Nouveau decorative style"
- "Minimalist Scandinavian design"

### 3. Materials and Textures

Describe materials explicitly:
- **Exterior**: Concrete, glass, wood, metal, stone
- **Interior**: Marble, hardwood, fabric, leather
- **Textures**: Smooth, rough, polished, weathered

**Examples:**
- "Weathered cedar wood siding"
- "Polished marble floors"
- "Raw concrete walls with formwork texture"

### 4. Environment and Context

Set the scene:
- **Location**: Urban, rural, coastal, mountain
- **Surroundings**: Trees, water, other buildings
- **Time of Day**: Morning, noon, sunset, night
- **Weather**: Sunny, cloudy, rainy, foggy

**Examples:**
- "Urban setting with city skyline in background"
- "Coastal location with ocean view"
- "Mountain setting surrounded by pine forests"

### 5. Lighting

Describe lighting conditions:
- **Natural Light**: Direct sun, diffused, golden hour
- **Artificial Light**: Warm, cool, accent lighting
- **Shadows**: Soft, hard, dramatic
- **Atmosphere**: Bright, moody, ethereal

**Examples:**
- "Golden hour sunlight casting long shadows"
- "Soft diffused daylight through large windows"
- "Dramatic evening lighting with warm interior glow"

### 6. Composition and Perspective

Guide the camera/view:
- **Angle**: Aerial, eye-level, low angle
- **Distance**: Close-up, medium, wide shot
- **Focus**: Foreground, background, specific elements

**Examples:**
- "Aerial view from above"
- "Eye-level perspective from street"
- "Close-up of entrance detail"

## Advanced Techniques

### Negative Prompts

Specify what to avoid:
- "No people, no vehicles, no text"
- "Avoid cluttered backgrounds"
- "No visible power lines or signs"

### Style References

Reference specific styles or architects:
- "In the style of Frank Lloyd Wright"
- "Bauhaus-inspired design"
- "Japanese minimalist aesthetic"

### Technical Details

Include architectural specifics:
- "Cantilevered structure"
- "Post-and-beam construction"
- "Curtain wall facade system"

### Mood and Atmosphere

Convey feeling:
- "Serene and peaceful"
- "Dynamic and energetic"
- "Luxurious and opulent"
- "Industrial and raw"

## Prompt Templates

### Exterior Architecture

```
[Building Type] in [Architectural Style], 
[Key Materials], [Notable Features], 
located in [Environment], 
[Time of Day] with [Lighting], 
[Perspective], [Style], [Quality]
```

### Interior Design

```
[Room Type] with [Style] design, 
[Key Materials and Colors], 
[Furniture and Layout], 
[Lighting Conditions], 
[View/Windows], [Mood], [Quality]
```

### Landscape Architecture

```
[Space Type] featuring [Elements], 
[Materials and Plants], 
[Layout and Flow], 
[Surrounding Context], 
[Time of Day], [Season], [Quality]
```

## Common Mistakes

### Too Vague
 "Nice building"
 "Modern glass office building with geometric facade"

### Too Complex
 "A building with everything"
 Focus on key elements

### Missing Context
 "House"
 "Contemporary single-family house in suburban setting"

### Inconsistent Style
 Mixing multiple conflicting styles
 Choose one style and be consistent

### Ignoring Environment
 "Building" (no context)
 "Building in urban setting with surrounding architecture"

## Iterative Refinement

### Start Broad
Begin with general concept:
"Modern house"

### Add Details
Refine with specifics:
"Modern minimalist house with large windows and flat roof"

### Include Context
Add environment:
"Modern minimalist house with large windows and flat roof, 
surrounded by mature trees, sunny day"

### Specify Style
Add rendering style:
"Modern minimalist house with large windows and flat roof, 
surrounded by mature trees, sunny day, 
photorealistic architectural photography"

## Using References

### Image References
- Upload clear reference images
- Describe what you want from the reference
- Combine multiple references
- Use as style guide, not exact copy

### Previous Renders
- Reference successful renders
- Build on what worked
- Use version mentions (@v1, @latest)
- Iterate on concepts

## Style-Specific Tips

### Photorealistic
- Include lighting details
- Specify camera settings
- Mention photography style
- Add realistic details

### Sketch/Illustration
- Mention drawing style
- Specify line weight
- Include artistic medium
- Add texture details

### Wireframe
- Focus on structure
- Mention line style
- Include technical details
- Specify view angle

## Quality Indicators

Add quality hints:
- "High detail"
- "Sharp focus"
- "Professional photography"
- "Architectural rendering quality"
- "4K resolution detail"

## Examples

### Good Prompt Example 1

```
Contemporary glass and steel office building, 
minimalist design with clean lines, 
curtain wall facade with bronze tinted glass, 
located in downtown urban setting, 
late afternoon golden hour lighting, 
aerial perspective, 
photorealistic architectural photography, 
high detail, professional rendering
```

### Good Prompt Example 2

```
Scandinavian-style single-family house, 
white painted wood siding with black window frames, 
pitched roof with dark shingles, 
surrounded by birch trees and wildflowers, 
soft morning light with gentle shadows, 
eye-level street view, 
photorealistic, 
warm and inviting atmosphere
```

### Good Prompt Example 3

```
Brutalist concrete apartment complex, 
raw concrete with visible formwork texture, 
geometric shapes and sharp angles, 
urban setting with other buildings visible, 
overcast day with diffused lighting, 
wide-angle perspective, 
photorealistic, 
dramatic and imposing presence
```

## Practice Tips

1. **Start Simple**: Begin with basic prompts
2. **Iterate**: Refine based on results
3. **Experiment**: Try different approaches
4. **Learn from Results**: See what works
5. **Build Library**: Save successful prompts

## Next Steps

- [Unified Chat Interface](/docs/unified-chat-interface) - Use prompts in the interface
- [Creating Your First Project](/docs/creating-your-first-project) - Start creating
- [Known Issues](/docs/known-issues) - Common problems and solutions

document.title: Unified Chat Interface
document.description: Complete guide to the unified chat interface - how it works, controls, and output

body.raw:
# Unified Chat Interface

The Unified Chat Interface is the heart of Renderiq's rendering system. It combines chat-based interaction with powerful AI rendering capabilities in one intuitive interface.

## Overview

The unified chat interface allows you to:
- Generate renders through natural conversation
- Upload and reference images
- Iterate on designs with context
- Control all rendering parameters
- View real-time progress

## Interface Layout

### Main Components

1. **Chat Area**: Where messages and renders appear
2. **Input Area**: Text input and controls
3. **Settings Panel**: Style, quality, and advanced options
4. **Render Preview**: Real-time preview of generated renders

### Layout Modes

- **Desktop**: Side-by-side chat and preview
- **Mobile**: Stacked layout with collapsible panels
- **Fullscreen**: Maximized render preview

## How It Works

### Basic Workflow

1. **Enter Prompt**: Type your design description
2. **Configure Settings**: Choose style, quality, aspect ratio
3. **Generate**: Click generate or press Enter
4. **View Result**: Render appears in chat
5. **Iterate**: Refine with follow-up prompts

### Message Types

#### User Messages
- Text prompts
- Image uploads
- Settings changes
- Commands

#### Assistant Messages
- Generated renders
- Status updates
- Error messages
- Suggestions

## Controls

### Input Controls

#### Text Input
- **Placeholder**: "Describe your design..."
- **Multiline**: Supports multi-line prompts
- **Auto-resize**: Expands as you type
- **Character Limit**: 2000 characters

#### Image Upload
- **Drag & Drop**: Drag images into the input area
- **Click to Upload**: Click the upload icon
- **Paste**: Paste from clipboard (if supported)
- **Supported Formats**: JPG, PNG, WebP

#### Send Button
- **Generate**: Creates a new render
- **Keyboard Shortcut**: Enter (or Cmd/Ctrl + Enter)

### Settings Panel

#### Style Selection
Choose from predefined styles:
- **Realistic**: Photorealistic rendering
- **Sketch**: Hand-drawn style
- **Wireframe**: Technical wireframe
- **Illustration**: Artistic illustration
- **Custom**: Define your own style

#### Quality Settings
- **Standard**: Fast, good quality (1 credit)
- **High**: Better quality, slower (2 credits)
- **Ultra**: Best quality, slowest (3 credits)

#### Aspect Ratio
- **16:9**: Widescreen (default)
- **9:16**: Portrait/vertical
- **1:1**: Square
- **4:3**: Traditional
- **21:9**: Ultra-wide

#### Advanced Options

**Environment**
- Sunny, Overcast, Rainy
- Sunset, Sunrise, Night
- Foggy, Cloudy

**Effects**
- Photoreal, Sketch, Wireframe
- Illustration, Digital Art
- Custom effects

**Temperature**
- Controls creativity vs determinism
- Range: 0.0 (deterministic) to 1.0 (creative)
- Default: 0.7

**Seed**
- For reproducible results
- Leave empty for random
- Use same seed for consistency

**Negative Prompt**
- What to avoid in the render
- Example: "no people, no cars"

## Output

### Render Display

Each generated render shows:
- **Image/Video**: The generated content
- **Processing Time**: How long it took
- **Provider**: AI model used
- **Metadata**: Settings used

### Render Actions

#### View
- Click to view full size
- Zoom and pan
- Download option

#### Download
- Download original quality
- Choose format (PNG, JPG)
- Includes metadata

#### Share
- Generate shareable link
- Share to gallery
- Export options

#### Iterate
- Use as reference for next render
- Create variations
- Continue chain

#### Upscale
- Increase resolution
- 2x, 4x, or 10x upscaling
- Higher quality options

### Render History

View all renders in the chat:
- Scroll through history
- Click to view details
- Reference in new prompts
- Delete unwanted renders

## Advanced Features

### Version References

Reference previous renders using mentions:
- `@v1` - First render in chain
- `@v2` - Second render
- `@latest` - Most recent render
- `@previous` - Previous render

### Style Transfer

Apply styles from reference images:
1. Upload a style reference image
2. Enable style transfer
3. Generate with style applied

### Image-to-Image

Transform existing images:
1. Upload source image
2. Enter transformation prompt
3. Generate modified version

### Context Preservation

The interface maintains context:
- Previous renders in conversation
- Project settings
- Chain history
- User preferences

## Keyboard Shortcuts

- **Enter**: Send message / Generate
- **Shift + Enter**: New line
- **Cmd/Ctrl + K**: Focus input
- **Esc**: Close modals
- **Arrow Keys**: Navigate history (coming soon)

## Mobile Experience

### Optimized Layout
- Stacked interface
- Collapsible panels
- Touch-optimized controls
- Swipe gestures

### Mobile-Specific Features
- Camera upload
- Voice input (coming soon)
- Simplified controls
- Quick actions

## Tips for Best Results

### Writing Prompts
- Be specific and detailed
- Include style preferences
- Mention important elements
- Use architectural terminology

### Using References
- Upload clear reference images
- Use high-quality source images
- Combine multiple references
- Reference previous successful renders

### Iterating
- Start with broad concepts
- Refine with specific details
- Use version references
- Build on successful renders

### Settings
- Match quality to needs
- Use appropriate aspect ratios
- Experiment with styles
- Adjust temperature for creativity

## Troubleshooting

### Render Not Generating
- Check credits balance
- Verify prompt isn't empty
- Ensure settings are valid
- Check internet connection

### Poor Quality Results
- Increase quality setting
- Add more detail to prompt
- Use reference images
- Try different styles

### Slow Generation
- Lower quality setting
- Check server status
- Reduce image size
- Try again later

### Upload Issues
- Check file format
- Verify file size
- Try different browser
- Clear cache

## Next Steps

- [Prompt Engineering](/docs/prompt-engineering) - Master prompt writing
- [Creating Your First Project](/docs/creating-your-first-project) - Set up projects
- [Creating Your First Chain](/docs/creating-your-first-chain) - Organize renders

document.title: How to Turn a Sketch Into a Render Using AI (Free + Fast Guide)
document.excerpt: Architects often search for a quick sketch-to-render AI tool that doesn't distort design intent. This guide shows exactly how Renderiq converts hand sketches, linework, and early design concepts into clean, client-ready visuals in minutes. Learn how architecture-aware AI keeps your proportions, context, and materials accurateand how you can try it free. Perfect for architects, interior designers, and students who want fast, reliable rendering.
document.author: Renderiq Team
document.seoTitle: How to Turn a Sketch Into a Render Using AI - Free Guide 2025
document.seoDescription: Learn how to convert hand sketches into professional architectural renders using AI. Free guide for architects and designers using Renderiq's sketch-to-render AI tool.

body.raw:
# How to Turn a Sketch Into a Render Using AI (Free + Fast Guide)

Architects and designers constantly search for ways to transform their initial sketches into professional renders quickly. Traditional rendering workflows require hours of 3D modeling, material setup, and lighting configuration. But what if you could skip all that and go directly from sketch to render?

## Why Sketch-to-Render AI Matters

The sketch-to-render workflow is revolutionary because it respects your design intent. Unlike generic AI image generators that might distort proportions or add random elements, architecture-aware AI understands spatial relationships, scale, and context.

### The Problem with Generic AI Tools

Most AI image generators struggle with architectural sketches because they:

- Don't understand architectural proportions
- Add random elements that don't make sense
- Distort spatial relationships
- Ignore design context

### How Renderiq Solves This

Renderiq's architecture-aware AI is specifically trained to understand:

- **Proportional accuracy**: Maintains your original design proportions
- **Spatial context**: Understands interior vs. exterior spaces
- **Material consistency**: Applies realistic materials that make sense
- **Lighting logic**: Creates lighting that follows architectural principles

## Step-by-Step: Sketch to Render in Minutes

### Step 1: Prepare Your Sketch

Start with a clear sketch. The better your input, the better your output:

- **Clear linework**: Use dark, defined lines
- **Simple composition**: Focus on the main design elements
- **Good contrast**: Ensure your sketch has clear light/dark areas
- **Context clues**: Include elements that indicate scale (doors, windows, furniture)

### Step 2: Upload to Renderiq

1. Log into your Renderiq account (free tier available)
2. Navigate to the Render interface
3. Upload your sketch image
4. Select "Sketch to Render" mode

### Step 3: Choose Your Style

Renderiq offers multiple rendering styles:

- **Photorealistic**: Ultra-realistic renders for client presentations
- **Architectural visualization**: Clean, professional architectural style
- **Conceptual**: More artistic, design-focused visuals
- **Interior focused**: Optimized for interior design sketches

### Step 4: Generate and Refine

Once you generate your initial render:

- Review the output for accuracy
- Use the "Refine" feature to adjust specific areas
- Generate variations to explore different material options
- Export in your preferred resolution (HD or 4K)

## Real-World Use Cases

### For Architecture Students

- **Portfolio development**: Quickly visualize design concepts
- **Presentation prep**: Create professional visuals without complex software
- **Design iteration**: Explore multiple design options rapidly

### For Professional Architects

- **Client presentations**: Show design intent clearly and quickly
- **Early-stage visualization**: Communicate concepts before detailed modeling
- **Option exploration**: Generate multiple design variations efficiently

### For Interior Designers

- **Space planning**: Visualize layout concepts from sketches
- **Material selection**: See how different materials work together
- **Client communication**: Show design ideas before committing to detailed plans

## Tips for Best Results

1. **Start with quality sketches**: Clear, well-defined sketches produce better renders
2. **Use reference images**: Include context that helps the AI understand your design
3. **Iterate and refine**: Don't expect perfection on the first try
4. **Combine with text prompts**: Add descriptive prompts to guide the AI
5. **Export at high resolution**: Use HD or 4K for professional presentations

## Free vs. Paid: What You Get

### Free Tier

- 5 renders per month
- HD resolution exports
- Basic rendering styles
- Perfect for testing and learning

### Pro Tier

- Unlimited renders
- 4K resolution exports
- Advanced styles and refinements
- Priority processing
- Commercial use license

## Common Questions

**Q: How accurate are AI-generated renders from sketches?**
A: Renderiq maintains proportional accuracy and respects your design intent. The AI understands architectural context, so results are much more accurate than generic image generators.

**Q: Can I use this for commercial projects?**
A: Yes, with a Pro subscription, you can use renders for commercial projects, client presentations, and marketing materials.

**Q: How long does it take?**
A: Most renders complete in 30-60 seconds, depending on complexity and server load.

**Q: Do I need to know 3D modeling?**
A: No! That's the beauty of sketch-to-render AI. You can create professional renders without any 3D modeling knowledge.

## Conclusion

Sketch-to-render AI is transforming how architects and designers work. By eliminating the need for complex 3D modeling software, Renderiq makes professional visualization accessible to everyonefrom students to seasoned professionals.

The key is using an architecture-aware tool like Renderiq that understands your design intent and maintains accuracy. Start with the free tier to explore the possibilities, then upgrade when you're ready for unlimited professional use.

Ready to transform your sketches into professional renders? [Try Renderiq free today](/pricing).
